data.title: DISH Flex Pack Plan & Channel Lineup
data.meta_description: Learn more about the Flex Pack including its channel lineup, discounted price, free offers and more.
data.text:
What's included?

Satellite TV Retailer Finderâ„¢

Let our retailer tool automatically search for the best deals in your area!

State: Plan:

Local Chnls

DVR/HDTV

First off, the 50 channel starter pack (which is required) contains a nice mix of genres and categories; some of the more popular channels include: A&E, History, TBS, CNN, TNT, FX, TLC, E!, AMC, Travel, Cooking Channel, Comedy Central, IFC, etc. Each of the channel packs contain a set of top tier channels; so, for about $10, they're generally quite a good value. You can also swap or add/remove extra packs on a whim (at no extra charge), so you may want to try a few out and adjust as needed. The table below includes all the channels available in the starter as well as the top 10 channel packs. The packs are sorted by the following legend:

Locals Pack ($12/mo)

Kids Pack ($10/mo)

News Pack ($10/mo)

Regional Action($12/mo)

National Action ($10/mo)

Variety Pack ($6/mo)

Heartland Pack ($6/mo)

Outdoor Pack ($4/mo)

Stars & Stripes ($10/mo)

Latino Bonus ($10/mo)

For over 4 decades, DISH Network has been a leader in satellite TV entertainment, and now a growing player in wireless and over-the-top TV.

Our DISH Network rating: 98/100

From a fledgling startup (Echostar) to multimedia giant, DISH is doing a solid job of evolving with the digital times. While satellite TV isn't going away anytime soon, DISH smartly expanded into streaming TV with the launch of Sling TV (2015). It's always owned a huge band of wireless spectra and recently began to build out its infrastructure (DISH is now the 4th largest wireless carrier in the U.S.).

Back to satellite TV, DISH has over 8 million customers and still provides a very cost-effective way to watch a ton of channels. If streaming is too restrictive and/or you want plenty of live TV, we routinely recommend DISH to mid to large size families looking for plenty of options.
